item.title: Cisco IOS Config Generator
item.description: Cisco IOS Config Generator Generate Cisco IOS configuration files for common network setups. Customize configurations for routers, switches, and more. Basic Setup Interfaces Routing Security Services AAA Device Information Hostname: Domain Name: Enable Secret: Console Password: VTY Password: MOTD Banner: Interface Configuration Interface: GigabitEthernet0/0 GigabitEthernet0/1 FastEthernet0/0 FastEthernet0/1 Serial0/0/0 Serial0/0/1 Loopback0 Remove IP Address: Subnet Mask: Interface Enabled Add Description Description: Add Interface Routing Configuration Routing Protocol: None Static Routes RIP EIGRP OSPF Static Routes Destination Network: Subnet Mask: Next Hop: Remove Add Static Route RIP Configuration RIP Version: Version 1 Version 2 Networks (one per line): EIGRP Configuration Autonomous System Number: Networks (one per line): OSPF Configuration Process ID: Router ID (optional): Networks: Security Settings Enable SSH Auto-configure SSH requirements Adds domain-name if needed and places the RSA key command at the beginning of the configuration SSH Version: 1 2 Username: Password: SSH Key Generation SSH requires RSA keys to be generated on the device.

item.title: Junos Config Generator
item.description: Junos Config Generator Generate Juniper Junos configuration files for routers, switches, and security devices. Customize configurations with an intuitive interface. Basic Setup Interfaces Routing Security Services Policy Device Information Hostname: Domain Name: Root Password: Use Encrypted Password (For Reference Only) Login User: User Password: User Class: super-user operator read-only System Timezone: UTC America/New_York America/Chicago America/Denver America/Los_Angeles Europe/London Europe/Paris Europe/Berlin Asia/Tokyo Asia/Singapore Australia/Sydney DNS Servers (comma separated): Interface Configuration Interface: ge-0/0/0 ge-0/0/1 xe-0/0/0 xe-0/0/1 et-0/0/0 lo0 em0 Custom Custom Interface Name: Remove Unit Number: IP Address: Prefix Length: Configure IPv6 IPv6 Address: Prefix Length: Add Description Description: Configure VLAN VLAN ID: Add Interface Routing Configuration Static Routes OSPF BGP Static Routes Destination Network: Prefix Length: Next Hop: Preference (optional): Remove Add Static Route OSPF Configuration Router ID: OSPF Areas Area ID: Interfaces (comma separated): Stub Area Remove Add OSPF Area BGP Configuration Local AS Number: Router ID: BGP Neighbors Peer Address: Peer AS Number: Description: Import Policy Import Policy Name: Export Policy Export Policy Name: Remove Add BGP Neighbor Security Settings Configure Firewall Filter Filter Name: Family: inet (IPv4) inet6 (IPv6) Term Name: Source Address (optional): Destination Address (optional): Protocol: any tcp udp icmp Source Port (optional): Destination Port: Action: accept discard reject Remove Add Filter Term Apply Filter Interface: Direction: input output Configure Security Zones (SRX only) Zone Name: Interfaces (comma separated): Allow intra-zone traffic Allow ping Allow SSH Allow Web Management Remove Add Security Zone Security Policies Policy Name: From Zone: trust To Zone: untrust Source Address: Destination Address: Application: Action: permit deny Enable Logging Remove Add Security Policy Network Services Enable NTP NTP Servers (one per line): Set Source Interface Source Interface: Configure DHCP Server Pool Name: Subnet: Address Range Low: Address Range High: Default Router: DNS Servers (comma separated): Domain Name: Lease Time (seconds): Remove Add DHCP Pool Configure Syslog Syslog Server: Facility: local0 local1 local2 local3 local4 local5 local6 local7 Severity Level: Emergency Alert Critical Error Warning Notice Info Debug Configure SNMP Community String: Location: Contact: Client List (comma separated): Policy Configuration Configure Policy Options Prefix Lists Prefix List Name: Prefixes (one per line): Remove Add Prefix List Route Filters Route Filter Name: Prefix: Filter Type: exact orlonger upto Remove Add Route Filter Routing Policies Policy Name: Term Name: From Protocol: -- Select Protocol -- static direct ospf bgp Use Prefix List Prefix List: Then Action: accept reject Remove Add Routing Policy Configure Class of Service (CoS) Classifier Name: Forwarding Classes Class Name: Queue Number: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 Remove Add Forwarding Class CoS Code Points DSCP Value: Forwarding Class: Remove Add Code Point Generate Configuration Reset Form Validate Configuration Configuration Validation Results: 0 Errors 0 Warnings 0 Suggestions Generated Configuration: Copy Configuration Copied!

item.title: Subnet Calculator
item.description: <div class="subnet-calculator"> <div class="input-group"> <label for="ip">IP Address (IPv4 or IPv6):</label> <input type="text" id="ip" placeholder="e.g., 192.168.1.0 or 2001:db8::"> </div> <div class="input-group"> <label for="cidr">CIDR Notation:</label> <input type="number" id="cidr" min="0" max="128" placeholder="e.g., 24 for IPv4, 64 for IPv6"> </div> <div class="input-group"> <label for="numSubnets">Number of Subnets (optional):</label> <input type="number" id="numSubnets" min="0" max="256" placeholder="Leave empty for no subdivision"> </div> <button class="calculate-button" onclick="calculateSubnet()">Calculate</button> <div id="result"></div> </div> <div class="features-list"> <h3>Features</h3> <ul> <li>IPv4 and IPv6 support</li> <li>Binary representation of addresses</li> <li>Network & Broadcast address calculation</li> <li>Usable IP range determination</li> <li>Wildcard mask calculation</li> <li>IP address classification</li> <li>Multiple subnet division calculator</li> <li>VLSM support</li> </ul> </div>

item.title: What is my IP?
item.description: What is my IP? This tool helps you quickly find out your current IP address and related information. Your IP Address: Loading... Refresh Country: Loading... Region: Loading... City: Loading... Location: Loading... ISP: Loading... Type: Loading... Additional Details Timezone Loading... Coordinates Loading... Currency Loading...
